results.title: Travellers' tales
results.creator_credit: Gregory Andorfer, Adrian Malone, Intel, BBC, Carl Sagan Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Cosmos: a personal voyage”.
In this episode Carl Sagan follows man’s passion to explore, from the Dutch sailors of the seventeenth century to the Voyager project and its rendezvous with Jupiter and its moons in 1979. He compares the change in vision that came with Christian Huygens’ study of light and astronomy in the seventeenth century and the impact of the detailed pictures sent back by the Voyager spacecraft on the scientists of today. The video includes a fairly detailed look at Jupiter and its moons and at life in seventeenth century Holland.

results.title: Travel tips
results.creator_credit: David McKenzie and Associated Television International
results.brief_description: Noted travel expert Laura Mckenzie takes us to various tourist destinations around the world. As well as suggesting places to visit, she also gives tips on clothing, climate, local customs, prices, accomodation, opening hours, etc.

results.title: Travel log
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Donald Winkler
results.brief_description:
A film of mystery set in a world of limbo: the world of the road. This travel album and diary—photographs on the screen, plus a woman’s words—tell the story of a couple who drifts apart, of a journey with no return. An introspective, haunting mood piece about intimacy and dispossession.
(Awards: Cracow; Cork; Melbourne; Yorkton)

results.title: Travel fantasies
results.brief_description: The ultimate travel fantasy begins with a gondola ride in Venice and ends on a cruise ship in the Pacific. In between, the armchair traveller can take a hot air balloon ride in France, fly Concorde with Lauren Bacall, see the snow covered Mount Batchelor or the world from the cockpit of an American Fighter Plane. A more sedate time can be had riding an elephant on a South African safari. This video documents the ultimate in around-the-world travel.

results.title: Travel & tourism: case studies for students
results.creator_credit: David Cordingley, BBC-TV and Cougar Films
results.brief_description: Designed for students and teachers of travel, tourism and leisure, this kit covers a wide range of themes in international tourism. The package is grouped into five units; Unit 1: From travel to tourism- looks at a historical view of tourism trends; Unit 2: Visitor attractions- looks at the venues that appeal to tourists ; Unit 3: The Business of tourism- looks at customer needs analysis and service, marketing and organisational structures; Unit 4: Conservation and access- looks at social and environmental challenges raised by tourism; and Unit 5: Interpretation- looks at the different ways in which information on tourist attractions is provided and presented in the marketplace. The kit uses excerpts from BBC programs such as ‘Pride and Prejudice’, ‘The Tourist’, and ‘Chronicle’ to illustrate key concepts. A guide accompanies the video.

results.title: Traps
results.brief_description: A film that is built around a simple narrative about the concerns of a reporter in public radio whose work takes her from the tele-room in March ‘83 when the present Labor Prime Minister Bob Hawke came to power, to the biennial Labor Party Conference and through to the elections in Dec. ‘84. Traps throws up a host of questions and leads on the nature of power and politics.

results.title: Trapping and heading
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 3 of Series “Pele: the master and his method”
Demonstrates trapping skills with cushioning, inside and outside-of-the-foot traps, sole and instep traps and trapping on the run. Also shows a variety of heading techniques including how to play heading tennis.

results.title: Trapped [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Melanie Coombs, Melodrama Pictures, Australian Film Commission and Trudy Hellier
results.brief_description: Jackie and Fran share a workplace, house, as well as the view into the prison next door. Together, with the two cell mates that watch them - Mat and Angus - they make two absurd couples who communicate via the radio and window voyeurism, vying for the best form of intimacy without physicality. Cast includes Jim Russell, Kate Atkinson, Genevieve Morris and Mark Wilson.
